title: Kerala University V-C suspends Registrar, sparks political row and legal showdown
content: The suspension, which has triggered both political backlash and the prospect of legal confrontation, relates to the event at Senate Hall here where a function was ‘disrupted’ over the display of the controversial Bharat Mata portrait

title: Kolkata college gang rape: WB women's panel head says 'traumatised' victim needs more counselling
content: West Bengal Commission for Women chairperson emphasises need for counselling and justice for gang-rape survivor in Kolkata college

title: Cases filed against 265 property tax evaders in Nellore
content: Appear for the National Lok Adalat to be held at Principal District and Sessions Court on July 5, says Nellore Municipal Corporation Commissioner

title: Drug cartel active across four continents busted in multi-agency operation
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah praises NCB and other agencies for the success; eight alleged syndicate members have been arrested so far

title: Suchitwa Mission to step up activities to reduce plastic use
content: International Plastic Bag Free Day on July 3. Suchitwa Mission calls on people to participate in activities to make State plastic-free

title: National Lok Adalat to be held in West Godavari district on July 5
content: Over 4600 pre-settlement cases identified across courts; litigants unable to appear in person owing to distance can settle their disputes online

title: Siddaramaiah asserts he will be CM for full five-year term; D.K. Shivakumar says he will abide by party’s decision
content: Statement comes after AICC chief Mallikarjun Kharge’s remark that the party high command will take a call the change of guard in the State government

title: Tourism caravans to hit Andhra Pradesh roads soon
content: First two vehicles will start operating around Suryalanka Beach in Bapatla district and Gandikota in Kadapa district by August, say Tourism officials

title: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu unveils ₹4,800- crore action plan for development of Kuppam constituency
content: It will be developed into a model town and a vibrant hub for solar energy, connectivity, and rural development, he asserts

title: Karnataka High Court permits CBI to expand scope of existing investigation in Valmiki corporation fraud case
content: Court allows agency to probe diversion of funds of Karnataka German Technical Training Institute as money reached same person accused in Valmiki corporation case

title: Forest department begins health assessment of elephants for Mysuru Dasara
content: DCF-led team visiting various camps ahead of shortlisting elephants for the festivities; list of jumbos likely to be announced after July 20

title: East Godavari leaders seek exclusive board for canal repairs in Godavari delta
content: Pollution of Tulabhaga channel, entry of brackishwater into agricultural fields and revival of DCCB were discussed at the General Body meeting in Kakinada

title: Shivamogga–Shikaripura–Ranebennur rail project trails as land acquisition hurdles persist
content: Despite more than four years since approval, physical progress of only 11.5% has been achieved so far, and no section of the line has been commissioned yet

title: Pension cancelled to one lakh persons with disabilities in Andhra Pradesh, alleges YSRCP
content: The NDA government in the State is harassing the disabled persons under the pretext of re-verification drive, the YSRCP alleges, and warns of agitation if justice is denied to such individuals

title: APNRTS aiming to empower Telugu diaspora, increase per capita income by 50 per cent: Ravi Vemuri
content: Society will organise a recruiting agents’ conclave by inviting agencies in India that provide employment opportunities abroad, and NRIs who are interested to join as recruiting agents in their respective countries, says APNRTS president

title: Student’s suicide in Palakkad: police seek legal advice for action against teachers
content: For booking five teachers of St. Dominic’s Convent English Medium School, Sreekrishnapuram, in Palakkad who are accused of abetting the suicide of a Class IX girl

title: Congress leaders were involved in fake transactions in National Herald case, ED tells court
content: ED’s counsel also submitted that the close associates of the Gandhi family and senior party leader were appointed as directors of AJL and they had done ‘fake transactions’ to funnel money

title: Kudumbashree to roll out ‘Ma Care’ kiosks in Kerala schools
content: Stationery, snacks and beverages, sanitary napkins to be provided through kiosks in high schools and higher secondary schools under the General Education department

title: 20 monkeys found dead near Gundlupet in Karnataka, probe ordered
content: The ghastly incident comes close on the heels of the recent poisoning deaths of five tigers in M.M. Hills region; forest authorities suspect the monkeys were killed elsewhere and their carcasses transported and dumped in the buffer zone of the Bandipur tiger reserve

title: DC forms panel to study cases of heart attack deaths in Hassan
content: The committee, which includes the District Health Officer, Director of Hassan Institute of Medical Sciences, cardiologists, among others, has been given a week’s time to submit the report.

title: PM Narendra Modi 5-nation tour LIVE: PM emplanes for Ghana
content: During the two-day visit to Ghana, PM Modi will hold high-level talks with President John Dramani Mahama, address Ghana’s Parliament, and oversee the signing of several agreements across various sectors.

title: Bengaluru Infosys techie arrested for filming female colleagues in washroom
content: The Bengaluru police said he had recorded two videos, and have sent his mobile phone to FSL for a details analysis.

title: Animal Husbandry department rolls out mobile vet unit to boost animal care in Alappuzha
content: In the initial phases, services of the unit are available at the District Veterinary Centre under the Alappuzha district panchayat and at five selected institutions

title: Congress will negotiate only with Uddhav, Sharad Pawar: Prithviraj Chavan on Maharashtra merger buzz
content: Chavan dubbed the talk of coming together of the Shiv Sena (UBT) and the Raj Thackeray-led Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) as a "family matter"

title: Congress slams Modi govt over Pakistan's UNSC presidency, calls it 'diplomatic setback'
content: Congress leader Surjewala claimed Pakistan's elevation came "despite all the bravado on foreign policy" displayed by Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Foreign Minister S. Jaishankar

title: Supreme Court seeks enquiry report from A.P. Government on illegal mining scam involving ex-MLA Vallabhaneni Vamsi
content: The Bench agreed to hear the State’s petition against anticipatory bail granted to YSR Congress Party leader Vallabhaneni Vamsi Mohan on July 17

title: Widows in Goa to get ₹4,000 monthly aid as government combines two women-centric welfare schemes
content: The eligible beneficiary does not need to apply to the women and child welfare department to cancel her name from its scheme as the social welfare department will ask it to delete their names

title: JSK – Janaki Vs State of Kerala row: Kerala High Court to watch film on July 5
content: Justice N. Nagaresh states a representative of both the petitioner, which is the production company, and censor board, or their counsel, be present during screening

title: Indian consumers more prone to sharing personal information with AI agents: Report
content: The global study, conducted by Statista, surveyed 6,750 consumers across nine countries, including 750 from India, to explore evolving online identity behaviours.

title: Opposition targets Maharashtra government over Thane tunnel project, alleges ₹3,000 crore scam
content: The tender process for the Thane-Borivali twin tunnel project was cancelled by the Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) in May after the L&T, which had been disqualified, moved the Supreme Court

title: NHRC issues notice to Odisha Government, DGP over two persons beaten up, forced to drink drain water
content: The National Human Rights Commission seeks report in 2 weeks, expected to include the action taken against the perpetrators and compensation, if any, provided to the victim

title: Mohali court extends SAD leader Majithia's remand by four days
content: The Punjab Vigilance Bureau arrested Mr. Majithia on June 25 in the DA case allegedly involving laundering of Rs 540 crore of "drug money".

title: Elderly woman duped of ₹1.15 crore by cyber fraudsters over six years
content: 70-year-old Mumbai woman loses ₹1.15 crore to cyber scamsters posing as I-T officials over six years in Mumbai

title: HR&CE Department saw remarkable growth under Dravidian model government: T.N. CM Stalin
content: Speaking at a free mass wedding event organised for 32 couples in Chennai, Mr. Stalin said a total of 2,376 free mass weddings have been conducted through the department in the last four years, including the 576 ceremonies held on Wednesday

title: Maharashtra Assembly session: Opposition walks out over farmer deaths, delay in payment to soybean cultivators
content: Congress leader Vijay Wadettiwar moved an adjournment motion seeking a discussion on the farmers issue; Speaker Rahul Narwekar, however, rejected the adjournment motion, following which Opposition members staged a walkout, accusing the government of insensitivity and avoiding discussion

title: Chellanam tetrapod: protest panel urges government to revisit piecemeal implementation of seawall construction
content: While welcoming government decision to erect tetrapod seawall on the Puthonthode-Cheriyakkadavu stretch, they say the decision is only a temporary relief

title: Grounded UK fighter jet gives Kerala Tourism a viral lift
content: F-35B fighter jet that remains grounded after making an emergency landing at Thiruvananthapuram airport on June 14 has sparked a flurry of trolls

title: Why PM Modi’s visit to Ghana matters: A look at India–Ghana bilateral relations
content: As Prime Minister Modi visits Ghana for the first time, India and the West African nation look to deepen decades-old ties across trade, development, and diplomacy. Here are the key things you need to know.

title: Kerala Industries department takes up rebranding exercise
content: New uniform colour scheme and style has been adopted for name boards of department and affiliated entities

title: Trivandrum Reads, an ardent group of bookworms in Thiruvananthapuram, celebrates reading and books
content: Trivandrum Reads, the silent reading community which meets every Saturday at the Napier Museum grounds, completes 100 sessions on July 5

title: Arrests, boat seizures will continue if Indian fishermen trespass, warns SL
content: There is no room for leniency, says Fisheries Minister; Sri Lankan fishermen call for talks with Tamil Nadu counterparts

title: Telangana factory blast | Sigachi Industries continued to operate with old machinery despite warnings, claims victim’s son
content: BDL Bhanur police have registered a case under sections 105 (punishment for culpable homicide not amounting to murder), 110 (attempt to commit culpable homicide), and 117 (voluntarily causing grievous hurt) of BNS Act

title: Madras High Court appoints mediator to resolve differences between Tamil film producers and FEFSI
content: Justice K. Kumaresh Babu requests retired judge M. Govindaraj to hold talks and submit a report to the court as early as possible

title: Chellanam tetrapod project: Kerala government approves ₹306-crore second phase
content: Proposed project to cover remaining 3.6-km stretch from Puthenthode to Cheriyakkadavu as was originally planned in first phase

title: Centre to file review plea against Madras HC order dispensing with husband’s signature in passport form
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh accepts a request made by Additional Solicitor General AR.L. Sundaresan for early hearing of the plea seeking clarification

title: Three killed in landslip in Odisha's Keonjhar: police
content: Illegal manganese mining in Odisha leads to landslip, killing three; bodies recovered and identified by police

title: Telangana pharma factory blast: One more body recovered from site, death toll rises to 37
content: Families of the workers still missing or unidentified waited outside, some clutching photographs, others simply hoping for a word

title: Politics of division creeping into Kerala society: Minister Saji Cherian
content: Saji Cherian says while one group was opposing zumba dance, another was deliberately targeting the film JSK – Janaki vs State of Kerala

title: Siddaramaiah asserts he will be Karnataka Chief Minister for full five-year term
content: The Congress leader ended speculation of a power-sharing agreement that was rumoured to give D.K. Shivakumar the Chief Minister’s chair later this year

title: LDF in Kerala scrambles to counter Opposition claims of public health sector decline
content: Editorial in CPI(M) mouthpiece Deshabhimani states contentious social media post by Dr. Haris Chirackal inadvertently provided grist for Opposition and right-wing media to obscure Kerala’s stellar achievements in public health sector

title: NBA free agent rankings: Pelton's new top 10, plus best fits
content: Which stars are available? Which teams need them? Kevin Pelton reveals his updated top 10, now including a former MVP.

title: 'Reckless': What league insiders are saying about this stunning set of Bucks moves
content: Damian Lillard waived, Myles Turner to Milwaukee. What do the moves mean for the Bucks, Pacers and the NBA?

title: 'Resilient' Fever, missing Clark, win in-season title
content: Despite being without star Caitlin Clark and playing the league's first-place team on its home court, the 10.5-point underdog Fever defeated the Lynx 74-59 to win the WNBA Commissioner's Cup.

title: Keys cruises following day of upsets at Wimbledon
content: Following a day of upsets, No. 6 Madison Keys eased into the third round at Wimbledon with a 6-4, 6-2 victory over Olga Danilovic on Wednesday.

title: Sources: Pistons add Robinson in sign-and-trade
content: Free agent sharpshooter Duncan Robinson has agreed to a three-year, $48 million deal with the Detroit Pistons, sources told ESPN on Tuesday.

title: Penn to ban trans athletes, ending Thomas case
content: The University of Pennsylvania has agreed to ban transgender women from its women's sports teams to resolve a federal civil rights case.

title: Red Panda injured during Fever-Lynx halftime
content: The popular halftime performer Red Panda was injured at the start of her act at the WNBA Commissioner's Cup championship game at Target Center on Tuesday.

title: Astros' Alvarez to see hand specialist after setback
content: Astros slugger Yordan Alvarez has experienced a setback in his recovery from a broken right hand and will see a specialist.

title: Springer's 7 RBIs help Jays pile on Yankees late
content: George Springer had a career-high seven RBIs, including his ninth grand slam, to help the Blue Jays beat the Yankees 12-5, drawing within one game of the AL East leaders.

title: Sources: Bucks waive Lillard, agree with Turner
content: The Bucks are waiving Damian Lillard and stretching the remaining $113M on his contract in order to acquire free agent center Myles Turner, sources told ESPN.

title: Introducing the 'Bag' Hall of Fame: Eight NFL stars who got PAID, over and over and over again
content: Which NFL players have negotiated the most profitable contracts over their careers? Bill Barnwell gives his picks.

title: How the Fever rallied past the Lynx to win the WNBA Commissioner's Cup
content: Playing without Caitlin Clark, Indiana had its best defensive effort of 2025 to win the Commissioner's Cup.

title: From a Cy Young winner to an All-Star closer: One player every MLB team should trade for (or away) this July
content: The deadline is a month away. Could players like Eugenio Suarez and Emmanuel Clase finish the season on a different team?

title: USMNT’s grit, character are shining at Gold Cup, and that will help at 2026 World Cup
content: This USMNT squad is learning so much about itself -- the biggest thing might be its grace under pressure.

title: Latest rosters for 90-plus teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're tracking all personnel movement for key teams heading into 2025-26.

title: NFL players are busy reading these authors, from Tolstoy to Belichick
content: A.J. Brown made reading cool after his viral moment on the bench in January. But what are other NFL players reading this summer?

title: Jalen Ramsey and Jonnu Smith for Minkah Fitzpatrick?!? We graded the Steelers-Dolphins blockbuster
content: Do Ramsey and Smith actually elevate Pittsburgh's roster? Did Miami maximize its return with Fitzpatrick? Let's size up the big trade.

title: Inside the MLB draft journey for the sons of two former major leaguers
content: They share a home state, have ex-MLB outfielders for dads -- and took two very different paths to the top of the draft.

title: A new kind of mock draft: Our insiders make the picks for all 30 teams -- with trades!
content: Blockbuster trades and high-risk picks. ESPN's experts team up for the mock draft you didn't know you needed.

title: The Club World Cup means little for teams' 2025-26 prospects
content: Some of the world's biggest clubs have been knocked out of the Club World Cup, but that's no reason for their fans to panic about 2025-26.

title: Mbappe's CWC debut was badly needed for Real Madrid, FIFA and the player himself
content: Kylian Mbappe's return for Real Madrid was needed: for him, for his team, and for the Club World Cup itself.

title: Euro 2025 team-by-team preview, predictions, key players, more
content: The 2025 UEFA Women's European Championship starts on July 2. Here is a team-by-team guide on the 16 contenders.

title: How Wiegman's 'new England' have evolved ahead of Euro 2025
content: England won Euro 2022 but have undergone some changes in the three years since. How are they looking ahead of their title defense?

title: MMA pound-for-pound rankings: After Ilia Topuria's title-winning KO, who's No. 1 now?
content: Does the new lightweight champion leapfrog Islam Makhachev, who vacated the title, in ESPN's latest rankings?

title: WNBA Power Rankings: Aces, Valkyries, Mystics rise
content: The Aces have had an up-and-down season so far. Can they build on the momentum after defeating Phoenix?

title: Juve boss: 10 players asked to be replaced in loss
content: Juventus coach Igor Tudor said 10 players asked to be substituted during his team's FIFA Club World Cup defeat against Real Madrid.

title: Poch: Support for Tillman shows U.S. 'connected'
content: ST. LOUIS - United States manager Mauricio Pochettino lauded the bond that is developing among the players and staff ahead of Wednesday's Gold Cup semifinal against Guatemala.

title: Hayes: U.S. entering 'next phase' ahead of WWC
content: USWNT head coach Emma Hayes said she "feel[s] like we're entering the next phase" as she narrows her player pool ahead of the 2027 Women's World Cup.

title: Guirassy's double sends Dortmund to CWC QF
content: Serhou Guirassy scored a brace in the first half to lead Borussia Dortmund to a 2-1 victory over Monterrey in the Club World Cup's round of 16, setting up a quarterfinal match against Real Madrid.

title: Toronto ends contracts of Insigne, Bernardeschi
content: Toronto FC have mutually agreed to terminate the contracts of former Italy internationals Lorenzo Insigne and Fernando Bernadeschi, the MLS club announced Tuesday.

title: Kepa joins Arsenal in $6.9M deal from Chelsea
content: Arsenal have completed a deal to sign goalkeeper Kepa Arrizabalaga from Chelsea, the club has confirmed.

title: Report: Crew owner sells stake valued at $900m
content: Haslam Sports Group has sold a 10% stake in the Columbus Crew to the Edwards family at a franchise valuation of $900 million, Sportico reported Tuesday.

title: Ibrahimovic: 'Messi plays with statues' at Miami
content: Zlatan Ibrahimovic defended Lionel Messi following Inter Miami's elimination from the FIFA Club World Cup and likened the superstar's teammates to "statues."

title: Transfer rumors, news: Bayern turn to Rashford after Díaz move turned down
content: Bayern Munich are set to step up their interest in Manchester United's Marcus Rashford. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Barcelona unveil 2025-26 home kit for return to Camp Nou
content: Lamine Yamal and Barcelona will be wearing the club's classic stripes but with a modern twist when they go home to Camp Nou after two years at Montjuïc.

title: China out, India-based Gaden Phodrang Trust will pick Dalai Lama successor
content: The Dalai Lama has declared that the institution of the Dalai Lama will persist after his death, with the Gaden Phodrang Trust in India holding the authority to recognise his future reincarnation. He emphasised that the selection process should adhere to past Buddhist traditions, involving consultations with Tibetan Buddhist leaders and Dharma Protectors.

title: Kolkata rape case: 'Mango' took off his shirt to show 'no scratch marks'
content: Amidst the uproar following the Kolkata law college rape case, Manojit Mishra's lawyer, Raju Ganguly, claimed the absence of scratch marks on his client's body, except for a 'love bite.' Ganguly suggested examining the victim's phone records, hinting that the case might not be a rape. Kolkata police have transferred the investigation to the detective department.

title: President's rule in Bihar? Tejashwi alleges 'major controversy unfolding'
content: Tejashwi Yadav alleges a BJP conspiracy to impose President's Rule in Bihar post-election, claiming Amit Shah's support for Nitish Kumar is temporary. He accuses the Election Commission of disenfranchising the poor through electoral roll revisions, alleging bias towards the BJP and RSS. The upcoming assembly election pits the NDA against the Mahagathbandhan in a high-stakes battle.

title: Leave India...: Foxconn to Chinese staff at Indian iPhone factories; What's Beijing's role in this
content: Apple's iPhone production faces disruption as Foxconn experiences a significant withdrawal of Chinese engineers from its Indian facilities, impacting the ramp-up for iPhone 17 manufacturing. This exodus, influenced by China's efforts to restrict technology transfer and skilled labor exports, threatens Apple's ambitious goals to shift iPhone production to India amidst rising geopolitical tensions and supply chain diversification efforts.

title: BJP announces new leaders for seven states; inches closer to elect new national president
content: Bharatiya Janata Party appointed nine new presidents across seven states and two union territories, including key states like Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, and Telangana. The party is expected to announce state chiefs for West Bengal and Odisha soon. This move is part of BJP's second phase of its organizational drive, following internal elections completed in 28 states and union territories.

title: Big, Beautiful Bill: Trump calls it path to US making a ‘fortune’
content: US President Donald Trump's 'Big, Beautiful Bill' narrowly passed the Senate, facing concerns over welfare cuts and a $3 trillion debt increase. Trump claims the bill will bring unprecedented growth and investment, fueled by tariffs. The legislation extends tax cuts, reduces Medicaid and food assistance, and boosts border control spending.

title: Yashavi Jaiswal vs Ben Stokes war of words lights up Edgbaston – WATCH
content: During the second Test match at Edgbaston, Ben Stokes and Yashasvi Jaiswal had a heated exchange. This happened when Jaiswal took a quick single. Jaiswal responded sharply to Stokes' words. Jaiswal, who scored a century in the previous Test, reached his half-century. England chose to bowl after winning the toss. They kept the same team.

title: Microsoft’s second biggest job cuts: Company to layoff 9,000 employees
content: Microsoft is set to eliminate 9,000 positions globally, marking its second major layoff this year as it restructures and reduces management layers. The Xbox gaming division faces significant cuts, including at King, the Candy Crush developer. Despite strong financial performance, Microsoft aims to increase agility and effectiveness by flattening its organizational structure and removing redundant supervisory roles.

title: Sovereign Gold Bonds earn over 200% returns: RBI announces redemption price
content: The Reserve Bank of India has set the redemption price at Rs 9,628 per unit for two Sovereign Gold Bond (SGB) tranches, specifically the 2017-18 Series-XIV and 2018-19 Series-IV, maturing for premature redemption on July 1st.

title: Bengaluru shocker: Infosys employee caught filming woman in washroom; arrested
content: In Bengaluru, an Infosys employee, Swapnil Nagesh Mali, has been detained for allegedly recording a female colleague in a company washroom. The victim, a Technical Test Lead, reported the incident at the Electronics City office on June 30th. Colleagues discovered incriminating videos on Mali's phone, including one of the complainant.

title: 'Shami forced me to quit': Hasin Jahan calls pacer a criminal
content: Hasin Jahan, estranged wife of cricketer Mohammed Shami, alleges financial neglect and accuses him of ruining her life after she gave up her career post-marriage. The Calcutta High Court has directed Shami to pay Rs 4 lakh monthly as interim maintenance, Rs 1.5 lakh for Jahan and Rs 2.5 lakh for their daughter, deeming it 'just, fair and reasonable'.

title: Trump's warning to Elon Musk on 'Big Beautiful Bill': 'May have to close up shop ...'
content: Donald Trump has escalated his feud with Elon Musk, threatening to withdraw federal subsidies from Musk's companies and suggesting he return to South Africa. This stems from Musk's criticism of the "Big Beautiful Bill," which Trump supports, and Musk's threat to form a new political party. Musk, in turn, advocates for eliminating all subsidies, even those benefiting his own ventures.

title: 'Destination you'll never want to leave': UK F-35B’s extended vacation in Kerala
content: Kerala Tourism cleverly capitalized on the unexpected grounding of a British Royal Navy's advanced F-35B fighter jet at Thiruvananthapuram International Airport due to a hydraulic failure. They launched a witty marketing campaign, featuring the stranded jet with a humorous tagline and a five-star review, highlighting Kerala as an unforgettable destination.

title: 'Kuldeep is India's next attacking option after Bumrah': Ex-Aus captain slams India
content: Former Australian captain Aaron Finch has criticized India's team selection for the second Test against England, questioning the exclusion of Jasprit Bumrah and Kuldeep Yadav. Finch expressed surprise at benching Bumrah, considering him the world's best bowler. Shubman Gill cited workload management for Bumrah's absence and the desire for batting depth as reasons for not including Kuldeep.

title: Gujarat shocker: 14-year-old boy rapes, impregnates 16-year-old sister in Surat
content: In Surat, a shocking case has emerged involving a 16-year-old girl found pregnant, with her 14-year-old brother implicated. The pregnancy was discovered after she complained of abdominal pain. Police have filed an FIR, invoking the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita and POCSO Act. The boy will be presented before the Juvenile Justice Board.

title: Watch: John Cena makes surprise Wimbledon appearance; video goes viral
content: Wimbledon 2025 witnessed upsets on the court as several seeded players lost in the opening round. John Cena's presence in the stands created a buzz after the celebrity was seen with Shay Shariatzadeh. Other celebrities like Stuart Broad, David Beckham, and Maria Sharapova were also in attendance on the first day.

title: India no. 1 Praggnanandhaa makes honest admission: 'It's difficult to play classical'
content: Indian Grandmaster Praggnanandhaa suggests top chess players like Carlsen and Nakamura are shifting away from classical chess due to its demanding preparation and mental fatigue. He highlights the extensive opening preparation required in classical games, contrasting it with the freedom of freestyle chess. Praggnanandhaa acknowledges his preference for faster formats but emphasizes classical chess remains fundamental.

title: New strategic oil reserves! India to boost emergency stockpile
content: India is planning to build three more strategic oil storage facilities to boost its energy security. These new reserves, including facilities in Bikaner, Mangalore, and Bina, will add to the existing capacity of 5.33 million tonnes.

title: '16-year-old me': When Samantha Ruth Prabhu shared monochrome memory from her teen
content: Samantha Ruth Prabhu recently shared a nostalgic throwback photo on Instagram, offering fans a glimpse into her teenage years at 16. The monochrome picture captures a quiet moment of introspection, with Samantha seated on a couch, dressed in a printed short dress and white shrug. More recently, Samantha shared highlights from her June, including a heartwarming lunch date with Keerthy Suresh.

title: IND vs ENG: 'It should be taken out of the players hand' - Shastri on Bumrah
content: Former India coach Ravi Shastri expressed surprise at Jasprit Bumrah's exclusion from the crucial second Test against England. Shastri emphasized that captain and coach should decide the playing XI. He questioned Sai Sudharsan's dropping and felt for Kuldeep Yadav's continued wait. England chose to field first after winning the toss at Edgbaston.

title: Cheng Hao’s AI robot football stuns; historic Beijing match marks new era
content: In Beijing, China, history was made on June 29, 2025, with the first AI humanoid robot football tournament. Despite humorous moments like frequent falls and missed kicks, the event, organized by Booster Robotics, showcased the potential of AI in sports. Tsinghua University's THU Robotics team emerged victorious, marking a significant step in the evolution of AI-driven athletic competition.

title: Vanessa Bryant shares rare throwback— features Kobe and sister Sophie — birthday homage
content: Vanessa Bryant recently shared a nostalgic throwback picture featuring her late husband, Kobe Bryant, on her sister Sophie's birthday, reminding Lakers fans of cherished NBA memories. She also addressed and dismissed rumors of her pregnancy, emphasizing her focus on family and personal well-being.

title: ‘I ran with it’: Musk regrets wielding chainsaw at CPAC
content: Elon Musk regrets wielding a chainsaw at CPAC, admitting it "lacked empathy." He received the chainsaw from Argentine President Javier Milei, symbolizing budget cuts. This follows a dispute with Donald Trump over federal subsidies, with Trump suggesting Musk might return to South Africa without them. Musk has resisted escalating the conflict despite Trump's remarks.

title: Cong 'unity show' flatlines? Shivakumar backs Siddaramaiah; says 'no option'
content: Tensions within the Karnataka Congress resurfaced as DK Shivakumar reluctantly pledged support to Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, despite earlier leadership change expectations. This development follows assurances from the party high command that Siddaramaiah will complete his full term, dismissing speculations of internal rifts and leadership shifts. The party is trying to project a united front amidst ongoing speculation.

title: 'Successor must be approved by us': China reacts strongly to Dalai Lama's remarks
content: China insists on approving the next Dalai Lama. However, the current Dalai Lama says the selection should follow Tibetan Buddhist traditions. He reiterated this ahead of his 90th birthday. The Dalai Lama has entrusted the Gaden Phodrang Trust with overseeing the search. The current Dalai Lama fled to India in 1959.

title: Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma’s London cafe date; video resurfaces amid moving to UK buzz
content: A resurfaced video from summer 2023 showing Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma at a London cafe has fueled speculation about a permanent move to the UK. Reports suggest the couple is considering relocating to provide their children with a more private life, away from constant attention in India.

title: 'I have a family': Abhishek Bachchan reacts to misinformation and online trolling
content: Abhishek Bachchan breaks silence on why he never clarifies any misinformation surrounding him and admits that it's quite upsetting. However, he believes that people who put out such negativity have to deal with their conscience. He also opens up on trolls recalling an old incident where his friend Sikandar Kher gave a befitting reply!

title: Air India crash: AI fake news, videos go viral; fraudsters exploit public vulnerability
content: Following the Air India Flight 171 crash in Ahmedabad, AI-generated misinformation, including fake reports and visuals, spread rapidly, exacerbating confusion due to delayed official information. Experts emphasize the urgent need for faster, transparent communication and platform responsibility to combat digital deception during crises. The incident highlights the growing challenge of AI-driven disinformation in sensitive events.

title: Giannis Antetokounmpo flirts with Warriors; sparks blockbuster buzz; fans stunned
content: The Golden State Warriors are reportedly leading contenders to acquire Giannis Antetokounmpo from the Milwaukee Bucks, according to recent reports. Trade discussions are actively exploring options to bring the two-time MVP to San Francisco, potentially reshaping the Warriors' future and keeping Stephen Curry in championship contention. The Bucks, facing uncertainty after an early playoff exit, may consider a rebuild.

title: Deadly attack in Pakistan: Top officer among 5 killed as roadside bomb explodes
content: A roadside bomb in Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province killed five, including a senior administrator, and injured 11. Authorities suspect the Pakistani Taliban (TTP), linked to the Afghan Taliban, is responsible for the attack in Bajaur. This incident follows a surge in militant violence and a recent suicide bombing, raising concerns about regional security.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Daftest selection decision' - Social media on Bumrah, Kuldeep, Sai absences
content: India made significant changes for the second Test against England, dropping Sai Sudharsan after his underwhelming debut and surprisingly excluding Kuldeep Yadav. Jasprit Bumrah is rested for workload management, leading to Akash Deep's inclusion alongside Washington Sundar and Nitish Kumar Reddy.

title: Women fight in Kalyan-CST local train, video goes viral- Watch
content: A video showing women fighting on a Kalyan-CST local train near Dombivli has gone viral. The altercation reportedly began over an unknown dispute, escalating into a physical fight where one woman was seen grabbing another's hair.

title: 'Outrageous': Lawyer sips beer during virtual hearing; faces contempt proceedings
content: The Gujarat High Court initiated contempt proceedings against senior counsel Bhaskar Tanna after a video surfaced showing him drinking from a beer mug and talking on the phone during a virtual hearing. The court deemed Tanna's behavior "outrageous and glaring," emphasizing the potential damage to the rule of law if such actions are ignored.

title: 'Wannabe Swift?’: Travis Kelce’s ex Kayla Nicole stuns in sultry date-night look; fans react
content: Amidst Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's publicized romance, Kelce's ex-girlfriend, Kayla Nicole, is captivating attention independently. Her recent Instagram post, featuring stunning photos in a black dress, went viral, drawing admiration from fans. Meanwhile, Kelce openly shares his affection for Swift, citing her song 'So High School' as reflective of their relationship.

title: Aamir Khan says he's tired of telling his son Junaid Khan to get a car
content: Aamir Khan revealed his son Junaid Khan's down-to-earth nature, highlighting his preference for public transport despite being a star-kid. Aamir shared that Junaid refuses to buy a car, opting for OLA or buses, and even took care of his grandparents during the pandemic. Junaid prioritizes convenience over luxury, choosing rickshaws and trains for efficient travel.

title: 2nd Test: 'You have best fast bowler in world.' - Former India coach fumes
content: Former India coach Ravi Shastri has criticized the team management's decision to rest Jasprit Bumrah for a crucial Test match. Shastri questioned the logic of benching the world's best fast bowler after a week's rest, especially given India's recent Test losses.

title: Ousted B'desh PM Sheikh Hasina sentenced to 6-month jail term
content: The International Crimes Tribunal (ICT) in Bangladesh has sentenced ousted Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to six months in prison for contempt of court. The tribunal-1, led by Justice Md Golam Mortuza Mozumder, also sentenced Shakil Akand Bulbul to two months in prison. This marks Hasina's first conviction since leaving office and the country 11 months prior.

title: Jockey Peta Tait dies in Melbourne stable accident; tributes pour in
content: The Australian horse racing community mourns the tragic loss of former jockey Peta Tait, who died in a workplace accident at a Cranbourne stable. The incident occurred when she was struck by a horse while working as a stable hand. Tributes have poured in, remembering Tait as a dedicated and passionate horsewoman.

title: Kolkata horror: Detective dept to take over case, say cops
content: Kolkata Police's Detective Department is now investigating the gangrape of a law student within a south Kolkata college. The survivor, a Trinamool student activist, was allegedly lured with a promise of a key post and then assaulted by three individuals, including a former student and current staff member.

title: REVEALED! Which Test will Bumrah play? Shubman finally answers the big question
content: India's pace bowler Jasprit Bumrah is set to rejoin the team for the third Test against England. The match will be held at Lord's next week. Shubman Gill confirmed Bumrah's return. Bumrah was rested for the second Test as part of workload management. Three changes were made to the team for the second Test.

title: Cheer for middle class soon? GST rates may come down on household items, say reports
content: The Goods and Services Tax slabs may be revamped soon, according to media reports. The government is planning to lower GST rates for household items, the reports claim. Gross GST collections reached a record high in fiscal year 2024-25.

title: Viral video: 'Jija kaun hai Indian team ka?' - Gambhir and Pant reveal
content: The Great Indian Kapil Show's upcoming episode features Rishabh Pant, coach Gautam Gambhir, Yuzvendra Chahal, and Abhishek Sharma. Pant humorously declares, "Don't take me for a sage." Gambhir jests about needing the players' permission and explains his serious demeanor allows others to enjoy. The cricketers playfully reveal Mohammed Shami as the biggest complainer, with Gambhir adding Shami misses his brother-in-law.

title: IND vs ENG: Why was Kuldeep Yadav not picked? Captain Gill provides update
content: India chose Washington Sundar over Kuldeep Yadav for the second Test against England at Edgbaston, prioritising batting depth. Shubman Gill cited the desire to strengthen the lower order, influenced by past batting performances and the inclusion of all-rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy. Jasprit Bumrah was also rested due to workload management, with an eye on the third Test at Lord's.

title: Girls skipped classes: How rape accused 'Mango's' return turned Kolkata law college into danger zone
content: Kolkata's law college faces turmoil as Monojit Mishra, accused of rape, returns as ad-hoc staff, triggering sharp drop in female student attendance. Students report feeling unsafe due to his intimidating presence and harassment. Mishra, previously expelled for criminal activities, allegedly controls the campus, accessing student data and threatening individuals.

title: Delhi Man Strangles Neighbour, Burns His Body Over Repeated Threats, Arrested
content: A man, along with his associates, who strangled and burnt his 19-year-old neighbour in outer Delhi's Narela area, has been arrested, an official said on Wednesday.

title: X Down For Thousands Of Users In US, Over 15,000 Report Issues
content: Elon Musk's X was down for thousands of users in the U.S. on Wednesday, according to outage tracking website Downdetector.com.

title: "Only Fat Palestinian On Earth...": Comedian Dave Chappelle Slams DJ Khaled
content: Actor-comedian Dave Chappelle has slammed Palestinian-American music producer DJ Khaled over his silence on Israel's brutal military campaign in Gaza.

title: Microsoft To Lay Off Over 9,000 Employees, 2nd Big Job Purge In Months: Report
content: Microsoft is laying off as many as 4%, or roughly 9,100, of its employees in the largest round of job cuts since 2023, the Seattle Times reported on Wednesday.

title: "Melania Needs To Go": Thousands Sign Deportation Petition Amid Crackdown
content: A progressive advocacy platform, called for the deportation of First Lady Melania Trump, her parents, and son Barron Trump--arguing that Trump's own family should not be exempted from the policies he championed.

title: Fake Judges, Court Hearings: UP Man Loses Rs 1 Crore In Digital Arrest Fraud
content: Uttar Pradesh Police on Wednesday arrested seven men who allegedly impersonated officials from the ED and the CBI to "digitally arrest" a Shahjahanpur resident and swindle more than Rs one crore through a fabricated online court proceeding,

title: Boy Smiles As Mother Makes Him Play Dress-Up, Then Family Dies By Suicide
content: Kavita dressed her son, Ramdev, in women's clothing, placed a dupatta on his head, applied kajal to his eyes, and put her own gold jewellery on him. Then her entire family - husband, herself, Ramdev and her other son - jumped into a water tank.

title: Hong Kong Proposes Legislation To Recognise Same-Sex Couples' Rights
content: Hong Kong government said it will propose legislation to recognise some rights of same-sex couples whose marriages are registered abroad, to comply with a 2023 court judgement.

title: Infosys Techie In Bengaluru Arrested For Filming Woman In Office Toilet
content: A techie working with Infosys in Bengaluru has been arrested for allegedly recording videos of a woman inside the office toilet.

title: IndiGo Launches Long-Haul International Ops With Manchester-Mumbai Flight
content: Domestic carrier IndiGo on Tuesday launched its long-haul international operations with its inaugural flight landing in Manchester from Mumbai.

title: How Many Teeth Does Your Labubu Doll Have? It Might Be A Lafufu
content: Dangling from luxury bags, showcased in unboxing videos, Labubu is now everywhere. But with popularity comes imitation. Enter the Lafufu, a counterfeit version of the toy that has become so common (and oddly beloved) it now has its cult following.

title: "No Choice": No Money For Oxen, Tractor, Elderly Couple Till Land For Crops
content: A heartbreaking video of a 75-year-old farmer tilling his land with his elderly wife in Maharashtra's Latur has put the spotlight on how farmers with limited resources are struggling to grow crops

title: Andhra IPS Officer Quits Service, Denies "Harassment, External Pressures"
content: Senior Indian Police Service (IPS) officer Siddharth Kaushal has announced his voluntary resignation, ending a career in law enforcement across Andhra Pradesh.

title: Mumbai Panipuri Seller's Son Once Failed Class 11, Now Has A Seat In IIT
content: Harsh Gupta, from Maharashtra, worked tirelessly with unwavering dedication. He retook the exams and cleared them, and also scored good marks in Class 12.

title: Karnataka Cabinet Renames Bengaluru Rural As Bengaluru North
content: The Karnataka cabinet on Wednesday approved the renaming of Bengaluru Rural district as 'Bengaluru North'.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Strange Reasons Behind Asim Munir's Anti-India Tirades
content: Glory dissipates fast during peacetime. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is finding that out the hard way. Munir, too, has his own embarrassment to deal with.

title: Trump Vows To 'Make NYC Great Again', Calls Mamdani "Communist Lunatic"
content: US President Donald Trump said that he will save the New York City from "Communist lunatic" Indian-origin mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani. In a post on Truth Social he wrote that he will not let the "Communist Lunatic" destroy New York.

title: "Complete Apathy": Delhi High Court Raps Civic Bodies Over State Of Public Toilets
content: The Delhi High Court on Wednesday chided municipal bodies for showing "complete apathy and insensitivity" in maintaining public toilets in the capital.

title: SBI To Report Anil Ambani To RBI, Classify RCom Account As Fraud
content: The State Bank of India (SBI) has decided to report the loan account of Reliance Communications as "fraud" in a case dating back to August 2015, the company said in an exchange filing.

title: 'Jinnahwadi Party': BJP Slams Congress After Leader Calls Sikkim A Country
content: Sikkim, which celebrated 50 years of its integration with India less than two months ago, has been called a "neighbouring country" by a Congress leader, sparking furore and prompting a scathing attack from the BJP and the SKM.

title: LaLiga 2025-26 fixtures: Clásico dates, more unmissable games
content: LaLiga's 2025-26 fixtures have been released. With managers, players and supporters able to plot their path to glory, here are the talking points.

content: Content based on the recent movie is now available in the game for those who've purchased the Iconic Edition.
